issue.title: [bug] Tauri window theme is not propagated to webview (`prefers-color-scheme`)

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue or pull request needs to be investigated

repository.name: wry
repository.description: Cross-platform WebView library in Rust for Tauri.

issue.body:
> This issue has been upstreamed from https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/5802 

### Describe the bug

No matter which [theme](https://tauri.app/v1/api/config#windowconfig.theme) I set in the Tauri config file, the WebView always answers CSS media query `prefers-color-scheme` with OS color theme. According to the [doc](https://docs.rs/tauri/1.2.2/tauri/window/struct.WindowBuilder.html#method.theme), it should only be the behavior is the `theme` field is `None`.

There is [a similar issue](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/22084) in Electron, and they managed to [fix it](https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/22900) by "propagate preferred color scheme to the renderer".

### Reproduction

1. Set Windows color mode in Personalization to "Dark".
2. In tauri.conf.json, set `windows[0].theme` to "Light".
3. In Rust `main()`, call main window's `theme()` to make sure it is `tauri::Theme::Light`.
4. In CSS, have different style for of both `@media (prefers-color-scheme: light)` and `@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark)`.
5. Observe that the section in `@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark)` is used.

### Expected behavior

If `theme()` returns `Light`, styles in `@media (prefers-color-scheme: light)` should be used.

### Platform and versions

```
Environment
  › OS: Windows 10.0.22621 X64
  › Webview2: 108.0.1462.44
  › MSVC: 
      - Visual Studio Community 2022
  › Node.js: 18.12.1
  › npm: 8.19.2
  › pnpm: 7.18.1
  › yarn: Not installed!
  › rustup: 1.25.1
  › rustc: 1.65.0
  › cargo: 1.65.0
  › Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc 

Packages
  › @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.2.2
  › @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.2.0
  › tauri [RUST]: 1.2.2,
  › tauri-build [RUST]: 1.2.1,
  › tao [RUST]: 0.15.6,
  › wry [RUST]: 0.23.2,

App
  › build-type: build
  › CSP: unset
  › distDir: ../dist
  › devPath: http://localhost:1420/
  › framework: Svelte
  › bundler: Vite

App directory structure
  ├─ .git
  ├─ dist
  ├─ node_modules
  ├─ src
  └─ src-tauri
```

### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

body: Upstream issue at https://github.com/tauri-apps/wry/issues/806 has been closed.
@CrendKing thanks for the research, this has been implemented in upstream and when that is released, we will call it internally when changing the window theme.
Thanks. That's very fast patch. Looking forward to the fix here.

issue.title: [bug] CSS  prefered color scheme is not preserved on windows sleep and wakeup

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I think this problem is similar to #8180.
So basically the prefered color scheme is dark. After Windows (11 in my case) goes into sleep mode and then wakes up it is set to the light color scheme 
![Unbenannt](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/assets/64200003/448b15e7-8fe9-41c5-a835-43807ab7695a)


### Reproduction

1.  Use Windows 11
2. Create a tauri project with multiple color schemes (that are also different)
3. Select one as the default color scheme
4. Start the programm
5. Go into sleep mode 
![Unbenannt](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/assets/64200003/250b7efa-3131-4de0-aec6-fb1712c3c7b3)

6. Wake it up and observe the changes

### Expected behavior

The color scheme should stay the same

### Platform and versions

```text
[✔] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.23580 X64
    ✔ WebView2: 119.0.2151.44
    ✔ MSVC: Visual Studio Professional 2022
    ✔ rustc: 1.72.0 (5680fa18f 2023-08-23)
    ✔ cargo: 1.72.0 (103a7ff2e 2023-08-15)
    ✔ rustup: 1.26.0 (5af9b9484 2023-04-05)
    ✔ Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (default)
    - node: 20.5.1
    - npm: 10.2.2

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 1.3.0
    - tauri-build [RUST]: 1.3.0
    - wry [RUST]: 0.24.3
    - tao [RUST]: 0.16.2
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.5.1
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.5.6

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - distDir: ../dist
    - devPath: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: Svelte
    - bundler: Vite
```


### Stack trace

### Additional context

_No response_
